verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of the Preacher,<WH6953> the son<WH1121> of David,<WH1732> king<WH4428> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>
Vanity <WH1892> of vanities,<WH1892> saith<WH559> the Preacher,<WH6953> vanity<WH1892> of vanities;<WH1892> all<WH3605> is vanity.<WH1892>
What <WH4100> profit<WH3504> hath a man<WH120> of all<WH3605> his labor<WH5999> which he taketh<WH7945> <WH5998> under<WH8478> the sun?<WH8121>
One generation<WH1755> passeth away,<WH1980> and another generation<WH1755> cometh:<WH935> but the earth<WH776> abideth<WH5975> forever.<WH5769>
The sun<WH8121> also ariseth,<WH2224> and the sun<WH8121> goeth down,<WH935> and hasteth<WH7602> to<WH413> his place<WH4725> where<WH8033> he<WH1931> arose.<WH2224>

The wind<WH7307> goeth<WH1980> toward<WH413> the south,<WH1864> and turneth about<WH5437> unto<WH413> the north;<WH6828> it whirleth about<WH1980> continually,<WH5437> <WH5437> and the wind<WH7307> returneth again<WH7725> according<WH5921> to his circuits.<WH5439>

All <WH3605> the rivers<WH5158> run<WH1980> into<WH413> the sea;<WH3220> yet the sea<WH3220> is not<WH369> full;<WH4392> unto<WH413> the place<WH4725> from whence the rivers<WH7945> <WH5158> come,<WH1980> thither<WH8033> they<WH1992> return<WH7725> again.<WH1980>

All <WH3605> things<WH1697> are full of labor;<WH3023> man<WH376> cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> utter<WH1696> it: the eye<WH5869> is not<WH3808> satisfied<WH7646> with seeing,<WH7200> nor<WH3808> the ear<WH241> filled<WH4390> with hearing.<WH4480> <WH8085>

The thing<WH4100> that hath been,<WH7945> <WH1961> it<WH1931> is that which shall be;<WH7945> <WH1961> and that<WH4100> which is done<WH7945> <WH6213> is that<WH1931> which shall be done:<WH7945> <WH6213> and there is no<WH369> <WH3605> new<WH2319> thing under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121>

Is there<WH3426> any thing<WH1697> whereof it may be said,<WH7945> <WH559> See,<WH7200> this<WH2088> is new?<WH2319> it<WH1931> hath been<WH1961> already<WH3528> of old time,<WH5769> which<WH834> was<WH1961> before<WH4480> <WH6440> us.

There is no<WH369> remembrance<WH2146> of former<WH7223> things; neither<WH1571> <WH3808> shall there be<WH1961> any remembrance<WH2146> of things that are to come<WH7945> <WH1961> with<WH5973> those that shall come<WH7945> <WH1961> after.<WH314>
I <WH589> the Preacher<WH6953> was<WH1961> king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel<WH3478> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>

And I gave<WH5414> <WH853> my heart<WH3820> to seek<WH1875> and search out<WH8446> by wisdom<WH2451> concerning<WH5921> all<WH3605> things that<WH834> are done<WH6213> under<WH8478> heaven:<WH8064> this<WH1931> sore<WH7451> travail<WH6045> hath God<WH430> given<WH5414> to the sons<WH1121> of man<WH120> to be exercised<WH6031> therewith.

I have seen<WH7200> <WH853> all<WH3605> the works<WH4639> that are done<WH7945> <WH6213> under<WH8478> the sun;<WH8121> and, behold,<WH2009> all<WH3605> is vanity<WH1892> and vexation<WH7469> of spirit.<WH7307>
That which is crooked<WH5791> cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> be made straight:<WH8626> and that which is wanting<WH2642> cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> be numbered.<WH4487>

I <WH589> communed<WH1696> with<WH5973> mine own heart,<WH3820> saying,<WH559> Lo,<WH2009> I<WH589> am come to great estate,<WH1431> and have gotten more<WH3254> wisdom<WH2451> than<WH5921> all<WH3605> they that<WH834> have been<WH1961> before<WH6440> me in<WH5921> Jerusalem:<WH3389> yea, my heart<WH3820> had great<WH7235> experience<WH7200> of wisdom<WH2451> and knowledge.<WH1847>

And I gave<WH5414> my heart<WH3820> to know<WH3045> wisdom,<WH2451> and to know<WH3045> madness<WH1947> and folly:<WH5531> I perceived<WH3045> that this<WH2088> also<WH7945> <WH1571> is vexation<WH7475> of spirit.<WH7307>
For <WH3588> in much<WH7230> wisdom<WH2451> is much<WH7230> grief:<WH3708> and he that increaseth<WH3254> knowledge<WH1847> increaseth<WH3254> sorrow.<WH4341>
